analyzed: tat sādhu pratipadyatām

translated: All the Tathagatas said: “Make firm this vajra of the thought of Samantabhadra of all the Tathagatas, with this mantra: Oṃ, I am the nature of vajra.”

analyzed: atha yāvantaḥ sarva ākāśa dhātu samavasaraṇāḥ sarva tathāgata kāya vāc citta vajra dhātavaḥ
translated: Then, as many as are the vajra-elements of body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas, pervading the entire realm of space,

translated: Then that Blessed One, the great Bodhisattva Sarvārthasiddhi, was consecrated by all the Tathagatas with the vajra-name Vajradhātu, with this vajra-consecration:

original: Emanation of the deities from samadhi

analyzed: atha asyām viniḥsṛta mātrāyām tatas eva pāda talāt candra uttaraḥ eva tathāgataḥ niścacāra
translated: Then, as soon as this was emitted, from those very soles of the feet, the Tathāgata Candrottare emerged.

original: tasya maheśvarasya śire vajrapāṇi pādāvakrānte tadardhacandramūrdhanabhiṣikto /
analyzed: tasya maheśvarasya śire vajrapāṇi pāda avakrānte tad ardhacandra mūrdhan abhiṣiktaḥ
translated: Vajrapāṇi placed his feet on the head of that Maheśvara, and consecrated him with the half-moon on his forehead.

analyzed: vajrapāṇeḥ vāma pārśve sthitaḥ
translated: He stood on Vajrapāṇi's left side.

analyzed: tatas sarva tathāgataiḥ vajrapāṇeḥ mitrasya pāṇau vajra śūlam da tvā
translated: Then all the Tathāgatas gave Vajrapāṇi, the friend, the Vajra Spear in his hand,

analyzed: vajra vidyā uttamaḥ vajra vidyā uttamaḥ iti vajra nāma abhiṣekeṇa abhiṣiktaḥ
translated: and consecrated him with the name Vajravidyottama.

original: atha vajravidyottamo bodhisattvo mahāsattvaśca tena vajraśūlena cakraparivartanagatyā nṛtyopahārapūjāṃ kurvannidamudānamudānayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha vajravidyottamaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ca tena vajra śūlena cakra parivartana gatyā nṛtya upahāra pūjām kurvan idam udānam udānayāmāsa
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Vajravidyottama, with that Vajra Spear, performing the dance offering of the turning of the wheel, uttered this udāna:

analyzed: aho hi sarva buddhānām bodhi cittam anuttaram
translated: Ah! The unsurpassed bodhicitta of all Buddhas,

analyzed: yat pāda agra sparśena api buddha tvam prāpyate mayā iti
translated: By merely touching its foot, I attain Buddhahood.

analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ
translated: Then the great Bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi,

analyzed: tatas vajra krodha samādheḥ vyutthāya
translated: arising from the Vajra Wrath Samādhi,

analyzed: bhagavantam etām vācam uvāca
translated: spoke these words to the Blessed One:

original: ahaṃ bhagavaṃ sarvatathāgatairvajraṃ pāṇibhyāṃ datvā vajrapāṇitvenābhiṣiktaḥ //
analyzed: aham bhagavan sarva tathāgataiḥ vajram pāṇibhyām da tvā vajrapāṇi tvena abhiṣiktaḥ
translated: Blessed One, I have been given the Vajra in both hands by all the Tathāgatas and consecrated as Vajrapāṇi.

analyzed: tat eṣām deva ādīnām bāhya vajra kulānām asmin triloka vijaya mahā maṇḍale sthāna viniyogaṅkariṣyāmi
translated: I will now assign the places in this great maṇḍala of Trilokavijaya for these deities of the outer Vajra Family,

original: yena te satvā avaivartikā bhaviṣyanti anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhāv iti //🔽atha bhagavān vairocanas tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddha idaṃ sarvatathāgatoṣṇīṣamudājahāra oṃ vajrasatvoṣṇīṣa huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: yena te satvāḥ a vaivartikāḥ bhaviṣyanti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau iti  atha bhagavān vairocanaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ idam sarva tathāgata uṣṇīṣam udājahāra om vajra satva uṣṇīṣa hum phaṭ
translated: so that those beings will become irreversible from unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.🔽Then the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Vairocana, proclaimed this Uṣṇīṣa of all the Tathāgatas: Oṃ Vajrasattva Uṣṇīṣa Huṃ Phaṭ.

analyzed: atha asmin bhāṣita mātre sarva tathāgata uṣṇīṣemyaḥ viniḥsṛtaḥ bhagavat vajrapāṇi vigrahaḥ
translated: As soon as this was spoken, the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi's form emerged from the Uṣṇīṣa of all the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: nānā varṇa raśmayaḥ bhūtvā
translated: Becoming light rays of various colors,

analyzed: sarva lokadhātavaḥ vabhāsya
translated: they illuminated all the world systems.

analyzed: punar api bhagavataḥ vajrapāṇeḥ mūdham anupariveṣṭitāḥ
translated: Again, they encircled the head of the Blessed Vajrapāṇi.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata uṣṇīṣa tejaḥ rāśim bhūtvā sthitaḥ
translated: Becoming the mass of splendor of the Uṣṇīṣa of all the Tathāgatas, they remained there.

analyzed: atha tatas tejaḥ rāśitaḥ idam sarva tathāgata uṣṇīṣam niścacāra
translated: Then from that mass of splendor, this Uṣṇīṣa of all the Tathāgatas emerged:

original: oṃ namassarvatathāgatoṣṇīṣa tejorāśi anavalokitamūrdha hūṃ jvāla dhaka vidhaka dara vidara huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: om namaḥ sarva tathāgata uṣṇīṣa tejaḥ rāśi anavalokita mūrdha hūm jvāla dhaka vidhaka dara vidara hum phaṭ
translated: Oṃ, homage to the Uṣṇīṣa of all the Tathāgatas, the mass of splendor, the unobserved crown, Huṃ Jvāla Dhaṃ Dhaṃ Dhaṃ, Vidhaṃ Vidhaṃ Vidhaṃ, Dar Dar Dar, Vidara Vidara Vidara, Huṃ Phaṭ.

original: atha vajrapāṇirbodhisatvo mahāsatva idaṃ svavidyottamamudājahāraoṃ nisuṃbha vajra huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ idam sva vidyā uttamam udājahāra om nisuṃbha vajra hum phaṭ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi uttered his own supreme vidyā: Oṃ nisumbha vajra hūṃ phaṭ.

original: tataḥ punarapi vajrapāṇiḥ svahṛdayādidaṃ hṛdayamudājahāra oṃ ṭṭakki jjaḥ //
analyzed: tatas punar api vajrapāṇiḥ sva hṛdayāt idam hṛdayam udājahāra om ṭṭakki jjaḥ
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi again uttered this heart from his own heart: Oṃ ṭakki jaḥ.

original: atha vajragarbho bodhisatvo mahāsatva idaṃ svavidyottamamabhāṣat oṃ vajra ratnottama jvālaya huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha vajragarbhaḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ idam sva vidyā uttamam abhāṣat om vajra ratna uttama jvālaya hum phaṭ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajragarbha spoke this supreme vidyā of his own: Oṃ vajra ratnottama jvālaya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: atha vajranetro bodhisatvo mahāsatva idaṃ svavidyottamamabhāṣat oṃ svabhāvaśuddha vajrapadma śodhaya sarvān vidyottama huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha vajranetraḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ idam sva vidyā uttamam abhāṣat om svabhāva śuddha vajrapadma śodhaya sarvān vidyā uttama hum phaṭ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajranetra spoke this supreme vidyā of his own: Oṃ svabhāvaśuddha vajrapadma śodhaya sarvān vidyottama hūṃ phaṭ.

original: atha vajraviśvo bodhisattvo mahāsatva imaṃ svavidyottamamabhāṣat oṃ vajrakarmottama
analyzed: atha vajraviśvaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ imam sva vidyā uttamam abhāṣat om vajra karma uttama
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajraviśva spoke this supreme vidyā of his own: Oṃ vajrakarmauttama

original: vajradhara samayamanusmara suṃbhanisuṃbhākarṣaya praveśayāveśaya bandhaya samayaṃ
analyzed: vajradhara samayam anusmara suṃbha nisuṃbha ākarṣaya praveśaya āveśaya bandhaya samayam
translated: Vajradhara, remember the samaya! Sumbhanisumbha, draw in! Enter! Fascinate! Bind the samaya!

original: grahaya sarvakarmāṇi me kuru mahāsatva huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: grahaya sarva karmāṇi me kuru mahā satva hum phaṭ
translated: Seize! Perform all actions for me! Do it, great being! Hūṃ phaṭ!

original: atha vajravidyottamo bodhisatvo mahāsatva idaṃ svahṛdayaṃ bhagavato vajrapāṇeḥ pādavandanīyaṃ niryātayāmāsa oṃ suṃbha nisuṃbha vajravidyottama
analyzed: atha vajravidyottamaḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ idam sva hṛdayam bhagavataḥ vajrapāṇeḥ pāda vandanīyam niryātayāmāsa om suṃbha nisuṃbha vajra vidyā uttama
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Vajravidyottama, the Great Being, offered this his own heart to the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi, to be worshipped at his feet: Om, Sumbha nisumbha, Vajravidyottama,

analyzed: hum phaṭ
translated: Hūṃ phaṭ!

original: atha krodhavajro vidyārājo bhagavataścaraṇayornipatyeda svahṛdayamadāt huṃ vajraśūla //
analyzed: atha krodhavajraḥ vidyārājaḥ bhagavataḥ caraṇayoḥ nipatya idam sva hṛdayam adāt hum vajraśūla
translated: Then the Vidyārāja Krodhavajra, having bowed at the feet of the Blessed One, offered this his own heart: Hūṃ, Vajra-sūla!

original: atha māyāvajro vidyārājedaṃ svahṛdayamabhāṣat oṃ vajramāya vidarśaya sarva huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha māyāvajraḥ vidyārāja idam sva hṛdayam abhāṣat om vajramāya vidarśaya sarva hum phaṭ
translated: Then the Vidyārāja Māyāvajra spoke this his own heart: Om, Vajra-māyā, display all, Hūṃ phaṭ!

original: atha vajraghaṇṭo vidyārājaḥ svahṛdayamadāt oṃ vajraghaṇṭa raṇa raṇa huṃ phaṭ //🔽atha maunavajraḥ svahṛdayamadāt oṃ vajramauna mahāvrata huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha vajraghaṇṭaḥ vidyārājaḥ sva hṛdayam adāt om vajraghaṇṭa raṇa raṇa hum phaṭ  atha maunavajraḥ sva hṛdayam adāt om vajra mauna mahāvrata hum phaṭ
translated: Then the Vidyārāja Vajraghantā offered his own heart: Om, Vajraghantā, raṇa raṇa, Hūṃ phaṭ!🔽Then Vajra-mauna offered his own heart: Om, Vajra-mauna, great vow, Hūṃ phaṭ!

original: atha vajrāyudhaḥ svahṛdayamadāt oṃ vajrāyudha dāmaka huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha vajrāyudhaḥ sva hṛdayam adāt om vajrāyudha dāmaka hum phaṭ
translated: Then Vajrāyudha offered his own heart: Om, Vajrāyudha, noose, Hūṃ phaṭ!

analyzed: vidyārājanakāḥ
translated: The Vidyārājas.

original: atha vajrakuṇḍalirvajrakrodho bhagavate vajrapāṇaye idaṃ svahṛdayaṃ pādavandanīyaṃ niryātayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha vajra kuṇḍaliḥ vajra krodhaḥ bhagavate vajrapāṇaye idam sva hṛdayam pāda vandanīyam niryātayāmāsa
translated: Then Vajrakuṇḍalī, the Vajra Wrathful One, offered this his own heart to the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi, to be worshipped at his feet:

original: oṃ vajrakuṇḍali mahāvajrakrodha guhṇa hana daha paca vidhvaṃsaya /
analyzed: om vajrakuṇḍali mahā vajra krodha guhṇa hana daha paca vidhvaṃsaya
translated: Oṃ vajra-kuṇḍali, great vajra wrath, seize, strike, burn, cook, destroy!

original: vajreṇa mūrdhānaṃ sphālaya bhinda hṛdayaṃ vajrakrodha huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: vajreṇa mūrdhānam sphālaya bhinda hṛdayam vajra krodha hum phaṭ
translated: With the vajra, crush the head, split the heart, vajra wrath, hūṃ phaṭ!

analyzed: atha vajraprabhaḥ vajrakrodhaḥ idam sva hṛdayam adāt
translated: Then Vajra-prabha, the vajra wrath, gave this essence of his heart:

analyzed: om vajraprabha māraya saumya krodha hum phaṭ
translated: Oṃ vajra-prabha, kill, gentle wrath, hūṃ phaṭ!

analyzed: atha vajradaṇḍaḥ vajra krodhaḥ sva hṛdayam adāt
translated: Then Vajra-daṇḍa, the vajra wrath, gave his essence of his heart:

analyzed: om vajradaṇḍa tanuya sarva duṣṭān mahā krodha hum phaṭ
translated: Oṃ vajra-daṇḍa, torment all the wicked ones, great wrath, hūṃ phaṭ!

analyzed: atha vajrapiṅgalaḥ vajra krodhaḥ idam sva hṛdayam adāt
translated: Then Vajra-piṅgala, the vajra wrath, gave this essence of his heart:

analyzed: om vajrapiṅgala bhīṣaya sarva duṣṭān bhīma krodha hum phaṭ

analyzed: vajra krodhāḥ

analyzed: atha vajraśauṇḍaḥ gaṇapatiḥ bhagavate vajrapāṇaye idam hṛdayat niryātayati sma
translated: Then Vajra-śauṇḍa, the lord of the gaṇas, offered this essence of his heart to the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi:

analyzed: om vajraśauṇḍa mahāgaṇapati rakṣa sarva duṣṭebhyaḥ vajradhara ājñām pālaya hum phaṭ
translated: Oṃ vajra-śauṇḍa, great lord of the gaṇas, protect from all wicked ones, uphold the command of the vajra-holder, hūṃ phaṭ.

analyzed: atha vajramālaḥ idam sva hṛdayam adāt
translated: Then Vajra-māla gave this essence of his heart:

analyzed: om vajramāla gaṇapataye mālayā ākarṣaya praveśaya āveśaya bandhaya vaśīkuru māraya hum phaṭ
translated: Om, to Vajra Garland, Lord of the Ganas, with the garland, attract, lead in, possess, bind, subjugate, kill, hum phat!

analyzed: atha vajravaśī sva hṛdayam adāt
translated: Then Vajra Subjugation gave his heart:

analyzed: om vajra vaśī mahāgaṇapate vaśīkuru hum phaṭ
translated: Om, to Vajra Subjugation, Great Lord of the Ganas, subjugate, hum phat!

analyzed: atha vijayavajraḥ gaṇapatiḥ sva hṛdayam adāt
translated: Then the Victorious Vajra, Lord of the Ganas, gave his heart:

analyzed: om vajravijaya vijayam kuru mahāgaṇapati hum phaṭ
translated: Om, to Vajra Victory, bring victory, Great Lord of the Ganas, hum phat!

analyzed: gaṇapatayaḥ
translated: Lords of the Ganas.

analyzed: atha vajramusalaḥ vajra dūtaḥ idam sva hṛdayam vajrapāṇaye niryātayāmāsa
translated: Then Vajra Mace, the Vajra Messenger, offered this heart to Vajrapani:

analyzed: om vajra musala kṛṭṭa kuṭṭa sarva duṣṭān vajradūta huṃ phaṭ
translated: Om, to Vajra Mace, crush, crush all evildoers, Vajra Messenger, hum phat!

analyzed: atha vajrānilaḥ dūtaḥ sva hṛdayam adāt

analyzed: om vajra anila mahā vega ānaya sarva duṣṭān hum phaṭ
translated: Om, to Vajra Wind, with great speed, bring all evildoers, hum phat!

analyzed: atha vajrānalaḥ dūtaḥ sva hṛdayam adāt
translated: Then Vajra Fire, the Messenger, gave his heart:

analyzed: om vajra anala mahā dūta jvālaya sarva bhasmīkuru sarva duṣṭān hum phaṭ
translated: Om, to Vajra Fire, Great Messenger, burn, reduce to ashes all evildoers, hum phat!

analyzed: atha vajrabhairavaḥ dūtaḥ sva hṛdayam adāt
translated: Then Vajra Bhairava, the Messenger, gave his heart:

analyzed: om vajrabhairava vajradūta bhakṣaya sarva duṣṭān mahāyakṣa hum phaṭ
translated: Om vajra-bhairava vajra-messenger, devour all evil ones, great yaksha, hum phat!

analyzed: dūtāḥ

analyzed: atha vajrāṅkuśaḥ vajra ceṭaḥ idam sva hṛdayam bhagavate vajrapāṇaye niryātayāmāsa
translated: Then Vajra-Goad, the vajra servant, offered this heart to the Blessed One Vajrapani.

analyzed: om vajraṅkuśa ākarṣaya sarva mahā ceṭa hum phaṭ
translated: Om vajra-goad, draw in all, great servant, hum phat!

analyzed: atha vajrakālaḥ sva hṛdayam adāt
translated: Then Vajra-Time gave his heart.

analyzed: om vajrakāla mahā mṛtyum utpādaya hum phaṭ
translated: Om vajra-time, produce the great death, hum phat!

analyzed: atha vajravināyakaḥ sva hṛdayam adāt
translated: Then Vajra-Obstructor gave his heart.

analyzed: atha nāgavajraḥ idam sva hṛdayam bhagavate vajrāpāṇaye pāda vandanīyam  om nāga vajra ānaya sarva dhana dhānya hiraṇya suvarṇa maṇi muktā alaṅkāra ādīni sarva upakaraṇāni vajradhara samayam anusmara kaḍḍha gṛhṇa bandha hara hara

analyzed: ceṭāḥ
translated: The servants.

original: atha vajrapāṇirmahābodhisatva idaṃ sarvavajrakulākarṣaṇasamayamudājahāra oṃ vajrāṅkuśākarṣaya huṃ //🔽tataḥ praveśanasamayamudājahāra huṃ vajrapāśākaḍḍha huṃ //
analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ idam sarva vajra kula ākarṣaṇa samayam udājahāra om vajrāṅkuśa ākarṣaya hum  tatas praveśana samayam udājahāra hum hum
translated: Then the great Bodhisattva Vajrapani uttered this Law of the summoning of all the Vajra-Families: Om! Vajra-hook, summon! Hum!🔽Then he uttered the Law of entry: Hum! Vajra-noose, pull! Hum!

analyzed: tatas karmahṛdayam udājahāra om vajra karma sādhaya kṛt
translated: Then he uttered the heart of the rite: Om! Vajra-action, accomplish! Krit!

translated: Then Vajrapani spoke of this great mandala of all the Vajra-Families:

translated: Now I shall explain the supreme great mandala.

analyzed: dharmacakra pratīkāśam sūtraye sarva maṇḍalam
translated: The mandala of all the mandalas should be measured like the Wheel of the Dharma.

translated: Then the vidyādhara should say, When I say 'come,' do this. Then you should come and carry out my commands.

analyzed: tatas prabhṛti sakala tri loka adhipatiḥ bhavati
translated: From then on, one becomes the lord of the entire three worlds.

original: yathecchayā ca muhūrtamātreṇa sakalaṃ tribhuvanamājñāpayan bhramati /
analyzed: yathā icchayā ca muhūrta mātreṇa sakalam tribhuvanam ājñāpayan bhramati
translated: And in just a moment, as one wishes, one wanders commanding the entire three worlds.

analyzed: punar api eti ca
translated: And again one returns.

analyzed: nigraha anugraham kurvam
translated: Performing favor and punishment.

analyzed: divyāni ca triloka bhogāni ca upabhuñjan yathākāma karaṇīya tayā
translated: And enjoying divine pleasures of the three worlds, as one wishes.

analyzed: sarva sura adhipati yoṣitā ādyāḥ sarva yoṣitaḥ ārāgayitvā upabhuñjati
translated: Having delighted all the women, including the chief wives of all the gods, he enjoys them.

original: na ca tasya kaścit kiṃcicchaknoti kartuṃ /
analyzed: na ca tasya kaścid kiṃcid śaknoti kartum
translated: And no one is able to do anything to him.

original: huṃkāreṇa ca sarvaduṣṭadevādīn pramarditvā tatastāvatkalpaśatasahasrān jīvatītyāha bhagavān vajradharaḥ //
analyzed: huṃkāreṇa ca sarva duṣṭa deva ādīn pramarditvā tatas tāvat kalpa śata sahasrān jīvati iti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: And having crushed all the wicked gods and so forth with a hum sound, he lives for that many hundreds of thousands of eons. Thus says the Blessed One, Vajradhara.

original: atha mudrāsādhanamicched yathāvajjapaṃ kṛtvā māsānte vajrahuṃkārasamayamudrāṃ badhvā sakalāṃ rātriṃ japet /
analyzed: atha mudrā sādhanam icchet yathāvat japam kṛtvā māsa ante vajra huṃkāra samaya mudrām badhvā sakalām rātrim japet
translated: Then, if one wishes for the accomplishment of the mudras, having recited as before, at the end of the month, having formed the Vajra Humkara Samaya Mudra, one should recite throughout the night.

analyzed: tatas prabhāte mudrāḥ siddhāḥ bhavanti
translated: Then in the morning, the mudras will be accomplished.

analyzed: tatas yathāvat mudrābandhena huṃkāra prayuktena
translated: Then, by forming the mudras as before, with the hum sound applied,

analyzed: ākāśa gamana viśva saṃdarśana antardhāna māyā sandarśana sarva āveśana ākarṣaṇa vaśīkaraṇa sarva tuṣṭi saṃjanana sarva ratna abhiharaṇa mahā tejaḥ jvālā sandarśana ratna vṛṣṭi sandarśana mahā aṭṭahāsa pramuñcana sarva satva saṃśodhana chindana bhindana ṛtu cakra parivartana yathāvat tatva ullāpana sarva karma pravartana rakṣa jaṃbhana staṃbhana trāsana māraṇa sarva satva mudraṇa kāma rati kriyā pravartana abhiṣeka sarva bhāva gāyāp
translated: The display of traveling through space, the display of invisibility, the display of magic, the summoning of all, the attraction, the enthrallment, the generation of all pleasures, the stealing of all jewels, the display of the great blazing splendor, the display of the rain of jewels, the emitting of the great laughter, the purification of all beings, the cutting, the piercing, the reversal of the wheel of seasons, the truthful questioning, the performance of all actions, the protection, the stupefying, the paralyzing, the terrifying, the killing, the sealing of all beings, the performance of the rites of love and pleasure, the anointing, the bringing of all things, the dancing, the summoning, the entering, the bursting, the enthrallment, and so forth,

analyzed: sarva karmāṇi karoti iti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: all these actions are performed. Thus says the Blessed One, the Vajra Holder.

original: atha sūkṣmajñānasādhanamicchet tena vajrahuṃkārasamādhimabhyasatā tathaiva jāpayogena māsaṃ sādhayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: atha sūkṣmajñāna sādhanam icchet tena vajra huṃkāra samādhim abhyasatā tathā eva jāpa yogena māsam sādhayitavyam
translated: If one wishes for the accomplishment of subtle knowledge, then by one who practices the meditation of Vajra Humkara through the yoga of recitation in the same way, one should accomplish it for a month.

analyzed: tatas nte nena eva samādhinā sakalām rātrim japet
translated: Then at the end, one should recite throughout the night with this very meditation.

original: tāvad yāvat prabhāte pañcābhijñā bhūtvā sarvasatvānugrahanigrahakṣamo bhavatītyāha bhagavān vajradharaḥ //
analyzed: tāvat yāvat prabhāte pañca abhijñāḥ bhūtvā sarva satva anugraha nigraha kṣamaḥ bhavati iti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: Until dawn, one will become one who possesses the five superknowledges and will be able to favor and restrain all beings. Thus spoke the Blessed One, Vajradhara.

original: atha karmasādhanamicchet tena tathaiva japatā māsamekaṃ sādhayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: atha karma sādhanam icchet tena tathā eva japatā māsam ekam sādhayitavyam
translated: If one wishes for the accomplishment of activities, one should accomplish [the mantra] in the same way, repeating it for one month.

analyzed: tatas nte sakalām rātrim japet
translated: Then, at the end, one should repeat [the mantra] throughout the night.

analyzed: tatas sarva karmāṇi sidhyanti iti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: Then all activities will be accomplished. Thus spoke the Blessed One, Vajradhara.

original: tataḥ karmāṇi bhavanti sakṛduccāritena manīṣitayā rakṣādīni sarvakarmāṇi karoti //
analyzed: tatas karmāṇi bhavanti sakṛt uccāritena manīṣitayā rakṣā ādīni sarva karmāṇi karoti
translated: Then, the activities are as follows: By merely uttering [the mantra] once, one can perform all activities such as protection and so forth, as one wishes.
The extensive ritual of the accomplishment of the offerings of the Vajra family is complete.

analyzed: atha padmakula upacāra vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati
translated: Now, the extensive ritual of the offerings of the Lotus family is as follows.

analyzed: tatra āditas eva tāvat śata sahasram japet
translated: To begin with, one should repeat [the mantra] one hundred thousand times.

analyzed: pūrvam eva akṛtā bhavati tatas sādhanam bhavati
translated: One should do this before [performing] the accomplishment. Then, the accomplishment is as follows.

original: paṭe bhagavān sarvajagadvinayādyāḥ kartavyāstasya sarvapārśveṣu caturmaṇḍalayogena mahāsatvacatuṣṭayaḥ kāryaḥ ante ca devyaḥ /
analyzed: paṭe bhagavān sarva jagat vinaya ādyāḥ kartavyāḥ tasya sarva pārśveṣu catur maṇḍala yogena mahāsatva catuṣṭayaḥ kāryaḥ ante ca devyaḥ
translated: On a cloth, one should draw the Blessed One, with the various activities such as taming the entire world, and so forth. In all the directions, one should draw the four great beings in the form of a cross. At the end, one should draw the goddesses.

original: tataḥ sa eva jāpavidhivistaro māsānte sakalāṃ rātriṃ japet /
analyzed: tatas saḥ eva jāpa vidhi vistaraḥ māsa ante sakalām rātrim japet
translated: Then, at the end of the month, he should recite the extensive ritual of recitation all night long.

analyzed: tatas sarva jagat vinayaḥ bhagavān āgacchati
translated: Then, the Blessed One, the Tamer of the Entire World, comes.

analyzed: yathākālam vareṇa abhipracārayati iti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: As is proper, he bestows boons, says the Blessed One, Vajradhara.

original: atha mudrāsādhanamicchet tena tathaiva padmavajrimudrābandhaṃ kṛtvā yathāvan mucyāṣṭasāhasrikeṇa jāpena catuḥsandhyaṃ japet /
analyzed: atha mudrā sādhanam icchet tena tathā eva padma vajri mudrā bandham kṛtvā yathāvat mucya aṣṭa sāhasrikeṇa jāpena catur sandhyam japet
translated: If one wishes for the accomplishment of the mudra, then, having formed the mudra of Padmavajra in the same way, one should recite as is proper, with the recitation of eight thousand [mantras], four times a day.

analyzed: tatas sakalām rātrim mudrā bandhena japet
translated: Then, one should recite all night long, forming the mudra.

analyzed: prabhāte siddhiḥ bhavati
translated: In the morning, [the deity] will be accomplished.

original: tato mudrābandhena yathāvat sarvajagadvinayaṃ karotītyāha bhagavānavalokiteśvaraḥ //
analyzed: tatas mudrā bandhena yathāvat sarva jagat vinayam karoti iti āha bhagavān avalokiteśvaraḥ
translated: Then, by forming the mudra as is proper, one can tame the entire world, says the Blessed One, Avalokiteśvara.

original: atha samādhinayasādhanamamicchet tena tathaiva māsānte sakalāṃ rātriṃ yathābhirucitena samādhinā jāpo dātavyaḥ /
analyzed: atha tena tathā eva māsa ante sakalām rātrim yathā abhirucitena samādhinā jāpaḥ dātavyaḥ
translated: If one wishes for the accomplishment of the method of concentration, then, in the same way, at the end of the month, one should offer the recitation all night long with the concentration that is pleasing.

original: tataḥ prabhāte sarvasamādhaya āmukhībhavantītyāha bhagavān vajradharmaḥ //
analyzed: tatas prabhāte sarva samādhayaḥ āmukhībhavanti iti āha bhagavān vajradharmaḥ
translated: Then, in the morning, all concentrations will manifest, says the Blessed One, Vajradharma.

original: atha karmasādhanamicchet tathaiva japanmāsānte sakalāṃ rātriṃ japet /
analyzed: atha karma sādhanam icchet tathā eva japan māsa ante sakalām rātrim japet
translated: If one wishes for the accomplishment of activity, then, reciting in the same way, one should recite all night long at the end of the month.

analyzed: tatas sarva karma kṣayaḥ bhavati iti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: Then all actions are exhausted, said the Blessed One, Vajradhara.
The extensive ritual procedure for the service of the Lotus Family is complete.

analyzed: atha maṇi kula upacāra vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati
translated: Now, the extensive ritual procedure for the service of the Jewel Family is as follows.

original: tatrādita eva sarvatathāgatapraṇāmacatuṣṭayaṃ kṛtvā śatasahasraṃ japet /
analyzed: tatra āditas eva sarva tathāgata praṇāma catuṣṭayam kṛtvā śata sahasram japet
translated: There, having first paid homage to all the Tathagatas four times, one should recite [the mantra] one hundred thousand times.

original: tatastathaiva paṭe bhagavāṃ sarvārthasiddhiṃ caturmudrāmaṇḍalayogena likhet /
analyzed: tatas tathā eva paṭe bhagavān sarva artha siddhim catur mudrā maṇḍala yogena likhet
translated: Then, in the same way, one should draw the Blessed One Sarvārthasiddhi on a cloth, in the form of the four-seal maṇḍala.

analyzed: tatas tathā eva pūjām kṛtvā tathā eva sādhayet
translated: Then, having made offerings in the same way, one should accomplish [the practice] in the same way.

analyzed: māsa ante sakalām rātrim japet
translated: At the end of the month, one should recite [the mantra] throughout the night.

original: tataḥ prabhāte bhagavāṃ sarvatathāgatābhiṣekaratnaḥ ākāśagarbho bodhisatva āgatyābhiṣekaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: tatas prabhāte bhagavām sarva tathāgata abhiṣeka ratnaḥ ākāśagarbhaḥ bodhisatvaḥ āgatya abhiṣekam dadāti
translated: Then, at dawn, the Blessed One Sarvatathāgatābhiṣeka-ratna, the bodhisattva Ākāśagarbha, having come, bestows the consecration.

original: tenābhiṣekeṇa trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau vidyādharacakravartī bhavatītyāha bhagavān vajradharaḥ /
analyzed: tena abhiṣekeṇa tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau vidyādhara cakravartī bhavati iti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: By that consecration, one becomes a vidyādhara-cakravartin in the great trichiliocosm, said the Blessed One, Vajradhara.

original: atha mudrāsādhanamicchet tena tathaiva dharmavajriprayogeṇa vajraratnamudrā yathāvatsādhyā sarvāśākarmakarī bhavatī //
analyzed: atha mudrā sādhanam icchet tena tathā eva dharmavajri prayogeṇa vajraratna mudrā yathāvat sādhyā sarva āśā karma karī bhavatī
translated: Now, if one wishes to accomplish the seal, then by that very method of Dharmavajra, the Vajraratna seal should be accomplished as it is. It becomes the agent of all hopes.

original: atha maṇijñānamicchet sādhayituṃ tena tathaiva vajraratnodbhavasamādhiryathānukramato bhāvayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: atha maṇi jñānam icchet sādhayitum tena tathā eva vajra ratna udbhava samādhiḥ yathā anukramataḥ bhāvayitavyaḥ
translated: If one wishes to accomplish the knowledge of jewels, one should meditate on the Vajra Jewel Arising Samadhi in the same way, in sequence.

analyzed: niḥsvabhāvāt ākāśāt katham ratna saṃbhavaḥ iti
translated: How can a jewel arise from space, which is without inherent nature?

analyzed: ratnāt ca katham bodhisatva kāya saṃbhavaḥ iti
translated: And how can the body of a Bodhisattva arise from a jewel?

analyzed: imam samādhim catuḥsaṃdhyam bhāvya japet
translated: One should meditate on this samadhi at the four junctions of the day and night.

original: yathopari tato māsānte tenaiva samādhinā sakalāṃ rātriṃ japet /
analyzed: yathā upari tatas māsa ante tena eva samādhinā sakalām rātrim japet
translated: Then at the end of the month, one should recite the mantra throughout the night with that same samadhi.

analyzed: tatas prabhāte sarva tathāgataiḥ āgatya yathā abhirucitaḥ bhiṣicyate eti āha bhagavan ākāśagarbhaḥ
translated: Then in the morning, all the Tathagatas will come and consecrate one as they wish. Thus speaks the Blessed One, Akashagarbha.

original: atha kāmasādhanamicchet tathaiva japatā māsānte sakalāṃ rātriṃ japet /
analyzed: atha kāmasādhanam icchet tathā eva japatā māsa ante sakalām rātrim japet
translated: If one wishes to accomplish sensual enjoyment, one should recite the mantra in the same way. At the end of the month, one should recite throughout the night.

analyzed: tatas prabhāte bhagavān ākāśagarbhaḥ sarva artha sādhakaḥ bhavati iti
translated: Then in the morning, the Blessed One, Akashagarbha, will accomplish all aims.

analyzed: tatas sarva karmāṇi kuryāt iti āha bhagavān ārya vajradharaḥ
translated: Then one should perform all activities. Thus speaks the Blessed One, Noble Vajra Holder.

analyzed: maṇi kula upacāra vidhi vistaraḥ parisamāptaḥ
translated: The extensive ritual of the service of the Jewel Family is completed.

analyzed: atha sarva kula upacāra sādhāraṇa vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati
translated: Now follows the extensive ritual of the service common to all families.

analyzed: tatra āditas eva ca sarva hṛdaya upacāra vistaraḥ
translated: There, at the very beginning, is the extensive service of all the heart mantras.

original: hṛdayamanīṣitāni sarvatathāgatānāṃ sidhyantām ityuccārya hṛdayaṃ yathābhirucito japya sādhanavidhiḥ kartavya iti //
analyzed: hṛdaya manīṣitāni sarva tathāgatānām sidhyantām iti uccārya hṛdayam yathā abhirucitaḥ japya sādhana vidhiḥ kartavyaḥ iti
translated: Having uttered May the heart desires of all the Tathagatas be accomplished, one should perform the heart mantra recitation as desired, according to the method of practice.

analyzed: tatra ayam mudrā upacāra vidhiḥ
translated: There, this is the method of serving the mudras.

original: sarvamudrā me bhogyā bhavantī tyuktvā samayamudrāṃ badhvā yathābhirucito yathāśaktyā japet /
analyzed: sarva mudrā me bhogyā bhavantī ti uktvā samayamudrām badhvā yathā abhirucitaḥ yathāśaktyā japet
translated: Having said All mudras are to be enjoyed by me, one should form the samaya mudra and recite as desired, according to one's ability.

analyzed: tatas yathāvat siddhiḥ iti
translated: Then, accomplishment will occur as it should.

analyzed: tatra ayam sarva mantra upacāra vidhiḥ
translated: There, this is the method of serving all mantras.

analyzed: niḥprapañcā vāc siddhiḥ bhavatu
translated: May the accomplishment of non-elaborate speech occur.

original: sarvatathāgatasamādhayo me ājāyantām ityuktvā mantraṃ yathābhirucito japet /
analyzed: sarva tathāgata samādhayaḥ me ājāyantām iti uktvā mantram yathā abhirucitaḥ japet
translated: Having said May the samadhis of all Tathagatas arise in me, one should recite the mantra as desired.

analyzed: eṣā siddhiḥ iti
translated: This is the accomplishment.

analyzed: tatra ayam vidyā upacāra vidhiḥ
translated: There, this is the method of serving the vidyas.

original: avidyāndhā ca te me satvāḥ sarvatathāgatāśca vidyādhigamasaṃvarabhūtā ityuktvā vidyāṃ yathābhirucito japya sādhanamāvahed ityāha bhagavānāryavajradharaḥ
analyzed: avidyā andhā ca te me satvāḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ ca vidyā adhigama saṃvara bhūtāḥ iti uktvā vidyām yathā abhirucitaḥ japya sādhanam āvahet iti āha bhagavān ārya vajradharaḥ
translated: Having said Those beings are blinded by ignorance, and all Tathagatas are the field of the vow of attaining knowledge, one should recite the vidya as desired and bring about the accomplishment. Thus spoke the Blessed Noble Vajra Holder.

analyzed: atha sarva hṛdaya mudrā mantra vidyānām yathākāma karaṇīya tayā vajra jāpa vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati
translated: Now, the extensive vajra recitation ritual of all the heart-mind mantras and knowledge mantras for accomplishing one's desires is as follows.

original: yasya satvasya hṛnmudrāṃ mantraṃ vidyāṃ tu sādhayet /
analyzed: yasya sattvasya hṛd mudrām mantram vidyām tu sādhayet
translated: For whichever being's heart-mind seal, mantra, or knowledge mantra one wishes to accomplish,

original: jāpārthatastamātmānaṃ satvaṃ vā sādhya sidhyatī tyāha bhagavān vajrasatvaḥ //
analyzed: jāpa arthataḥ tam ātmānam satvam vā sādhya sidhyati iti āha bhagavān vajra satvaḥ
translated: by the power of recitation, that being or self will be accomplished. Thus spoke the Blessed One, Vajrasattva.

analyzed: sarva kula sādhāraṇa jāpa vidhi vistaraḥ parisamāptaḥ
translated: The extensive ritual of the common recitation of all the families is complete.

analyzed: atha sarva kula sādhāraṇa siddhi vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati
translated: Now, the extensive ritual of the common accomplishment of all the families is as follows.

analyzed: tatra āditas eva tathāgata kula siddhayaḥ
translated: There, first of all, are the accomplishments of the Tathagata family.

analyzed: tat yathārtha niṣpatti siddhiḥ ṛddhi siddhiḥ vidyādhara tvam mahā siddhiḥ ca iti
translated: They are: the accomplishment of fulfilling one's aims, the accomplishment of spiritual powers, the state of a knowledge-holder, and the great accomplishment.

original: tatrārthaniṣpattirbhavati /🔽yatrā nidhiśaṅkā bhavet tatra mudrāṃ badhvā svasamādhinā tannidhisthānaṃ vajradṛṣṭyā nirīkṣayet /
analyzed: tatra artha niṣpattiḥ bhavati  yatrā nidhi śaṅkā bhavet tatra mudrām badhvā sva samādhinā tad nidhi sthānam vajra dṛṣṭyā nirīkṣayet
translated: Therein, the fulfillment of one's aims occurs.🔽Wherever there is a suspicion of a treasure, one should bind the seal there, with one's own meditative concentration, and gaze at that treasure site with the vajra gaze.

original: yadi vajrākāramuttiṣṭhatvaṃ paśyati tathā jñātavyaṃ nidhiratrāstīti /
analyzed: yadi vajra ākāram uttiṣṭha tvam paśyati tathā jñātavyam nidhiḥ atra asti iti
translated: If one sees it rising up in the form of a vajra, one should know that a treasure exists there.

original: tato vajrasphoṭasamayamudrāṃ badhvotkhanya yathākāmakaraṇīyatayā gṛṇhīyādacirāt prāpnotī tyāha bhagavān vajrasatvaḥ //
analyzed: tatas vajrasphoṭa samaya mudrām badhvā utkhanya yathākāma karaṇīya tayā gṛṇhīyāt acirāt prāpnoti iti āha bhagavān vajra satvaḥ
translated: Then, having made the Vajra-bursting samaya mudra, one should dig and take it as one wishes. The Blessed One Vajrasattva says that one will soon obtain it.

analyzed: tatra ṛddhi siddhi niṣpattiḥ bhavati
translated: There, the accomplishment of magical power is perfected.

analyzed: yām mudrām sādhayet vajra siddhiḥ
translated: Whatever mudra one accomplishes, it is a vajra accomplishment.

original: ityuktvā ṛddhisiddhiścaturvidhā bhavanti tadyathā jalasyoparicaṃkramaṇaniṣīdatādikaṃ tathāgatādisarvarūpasaṃdarśanaṃ yāvadabhirucistāvad
analyzed: iti uktvā ṛddhi siddhiḥ caturvidhā bhavanti tat yathā jalasya upari caṃkramaṇa niṣīda tā ādikam tathāgata ādi sarva rūpa saṃdarśanam yāvat abhiruciḥ tāvat
translated: Having said this, the four kinds of magical power accomplishments are as follows: Walking, sitting, and so on, on the surface of water, manifesting all forms such as the Tathagata and so on, as much as one desires,

analyzed: a dreṣya tvam  ākāśa gāmī ca yojana sahasram ūrdhvam utpatya adhastāt ca gacchati
translated: one becomes invisible.🔽One goes through the sky, rising up a thousand yojanas and going below.

analyzed: sarvādiśaḥ ca yojana sahasrāt yathā abhirucita vegaḥ paribhramya āgacchati
translated: One goes around in all directions as much as one desires, a thousand yojanas, and returns.

analyzed: yojana sahasra ādarśena sarva satva manīṣitāni jñānāti
translated: One knows all the wishes of all beings by seeing a thousand yojanas away.

original: sarvabhāvāni ca cakṣuṣā paśyati śrotreṇa śṛṇoti /
analyzed: sarva bhāvāni ca cakṣuṣā paśyati śrotreṇa śṛṇoti
translated: One sees all things with the eyes and hears with the ears.

original: sarvadikṣu sa yojanasahasrādarśena mano 'bhirucitāḥ sarvastriyo 'ṅge samutkṣipyānayati /
analyzed: sarva dikṣu sa yojana sahasra ādarśena manaḥ abhirucitāḥ sarva striyaḥ ṅge samutkṣipya ānayati
translated: One takes all the women one desires in one's mind in all directions, a thousand yojanas away, and brings them to one's body.

analyzed: sarva hiraṇya suvarṇa maṇi muktā ādayaḥ ca sarva arthān apaharati
translated: All gold, silver, jewels, pearls, and so forth, and all objects, he takes away.

original: na cāsya kaścit kiṃcit chaknoti kartuṃ /
